DOC.brief_summary: This is a pilot study to generate hypotheses about the urodynamic effects of UK-369,003 in men with lower urinary tract symptoms.
DOC.brief_title: Urodynamic Effects of UK-369,003 in Men With Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms
DOC.criteria: Male subjects, aged 40 years and above, with documented LUTS with an International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) ≥13. Clinical diagnosis of BPH Qmax 5 to 15 ml/sec with a voided volume of ≥150 ml Urodynamically defined bladder outlet obstruction prostate cancer Postvoid residual urine volume >200 ml Documented UTI History of relevant urological surgery
